tasks.title: Project Setup and Repository Configuration
tasks.description: Initialize the Next.js project with TypeScript, configure Git repository, and set up the development environment with required dependencies.
tasks.details:
1. Create a new Next.js project using the latest version (14.x): `npx create-next-app@latest beonbike-pro --typescript --tailwind --eslint`
2. Configure Git repository with appropriate .gitignore
3. Install additional dependencies:
   - i18n support: `npm install next-i18next@latest`
   - SEO tools: `npm install next-seo@latest`
   - Styling: `npm install tailwindcss@latest postcss@latest autoprefixer@latest`
4. Set up ESLint and Prettier for code quality
5. Configure VS Code settings for optimal development experience
6. Create project structure following Next.js best practices:
   - `/pages` - Page components
   - `/components` - Reusable UI components
   - `/public` - Static assets
   - `/styles` - Global styles
   - `/locales` - Translation files
   - `/lib` - Utility functions
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify project builds successfully with `npm run build`
2. Ensure development server starts with `npm run dev`
3. Confirm TypeScript compilation works without errors
4. Test ESLint configuration with `npm run lint`
5. Verify all dependencies are correctly installed and compatible

subtasks.title: Initialize Next.js Project with TypeScript
subtasks.description: Create a new Next.js project with TypeScript support using the create-next-app command with the specified options.
subtasks.details: Run `npx create-next-app@latest beonbike-pro --typescript --tailwind --eslint` to create a new Next.js 14.x project with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and ESLint configurations. Verify the installation by running `npm run dev` and accessing http://localhost:3000.
subtasks.testStrategy: Ensure the development server starts without errors and the default Next.js page loads correctly in the browser.

subtasks.title: Configure Git Repository
subtasks.description: Set up Git version control with appropriate .gitignore file for Next.js projects.
subtasks.details: Initialize Git repository with `git init`, create or verify the .gitignore file includes Next.js specific entries (node_modules, .next, etc.). Make an initial commit with the base project structure.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that .gitignore properly excludes build artifacts and dependencies by running `git status`.

subtasks.title: Install Additional Dependencies
subtasks.description: Add required packages for internationalization, SEO, and styling enhancements.
subtasks.details: Install the specified dependencies using npm: `npm install next-i18next@latest next-seo@latest tailwindcss@latest postcss@latest autoprefixer@latest`. Verify installations in package.json.
subtasks.testStrategy: Check package.json to confirm all dependencies are installed with their latest versions.

subtasks.title: Configure Code Quality Tools
subtasks.description: Set up ESLint and Prettier for consistent code formatting and quality control.
subtasks.details: Configure ESLint with TypeScript support by extending the base configuration. Install Prettier with `npm install prettier --save-dev` and create configuration files (.prettierrc). Set up integration between ESLint and Prettier with `npm install eslint-plugin-prettier eslint-config-prettier --save-dev`.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run linting with `npx eslint .` to verify configuration works correctly.

subtasks.title: Set Up VS Code Development Environment
subtasks.description: Configure VS Code settings for optimal TypeScript and Next.js development.
subtasks.details: Create .vscode folder with settings.json and extensions.json files. Configure settings for TypeScript plugin, auto-formatting on save, and recommended extensions. Enable the Next.js TypeScript plugin in VS Code by selecting 'Use Workspace Version' in TypeScript settings.
subtasks.testStrategy: Open the project in VS Code and verify that TypeScript intellisense works correctly and formatting is applied on save.

subtasks.title: Create Project Directory Structure
subtasks.description: Establish the recommended folder structure following Next.js best practices.
subtasks.details: Create the following directories: `/pages` for page components, `/components` for reusable UI components, `/public` for static assets, `/styles` for global styles, `/locales` for translation files, and `/lib` for utility functions. Add placeholder files or README.md in each directory to maintain structure in version control.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify all directories exist and follow the Next.js conventions by checking the project structure.

tasks.title: Implement Base Layout and Design System
tasks.description: Create the foundational layout components and design system based on the specified color palette, typography, and UI requirements.
tasks.details:
1. Set up Tailwind CSS configuration with custom color palette:
   - Primary: Ocean blue (#0077BE)
   - Secondary: Electric green (#00CC66)
   - Accent: Sunset orange (#FF6B35)
   - Neutral: Charcoal gray (#333333) and light gray (#F5F5F5)
2. Configure typography using Inter font family:
   - Import from Google Fonts or use `next/font`
   - Set up font weights: 400 (regular), 500 (medium), 600-700 (bold)
3. Create base layout components:
   - Header with logo, navigation, language selector
   - Footer with contact info, social links, copyright
   - Main content container with responsive padding
4. Implement responsive breakpoints:
   - Mobile: 320px - 768px
   - Tablet: 769px - 1024px
   - Desktop: 1025px and above
5. Create UI component library:
   - Button variants (primary, secondary, CTA)
   - Card components for products and services
   - Navigation components (desktop and mobile)
6. Implement accessibility features (ARIA attributes, keyboard navigation)
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify responsive behavior across different screen sizes using browser dev tools
2. Test color contrast ratios meet WCAG 2.1 AA standards using accessibility tools
3. Validate component rendering in different browsers
4. Test keyboard navigation for all interactive elements
5. Verify font loading and fallback behavior

subtasks.testStrategy: Conduct accessibility testing using screen readers and keyboard navigation to verify WCAG compliance

tasks.title: Implement Internationalization (i18n) Support
tasks.description: Set up multilingual support for English and Spanish using Next.js i18n capabilities with JSON translation files.
tasks.details:
1. Configure Next.js i18n in `next.config.js`:
```javascript
module.exports = {
  i18n: {
    locales: ['en', 'es'],
    defaultLocale: 'en',
    localeDetection: true,
  },
}
```
2. Create translation directory structure:
   - `/public/locales/en/common.json`
   - `/public/locales/es/common.json`
3. Implement translation files for all website content
4. Create language switcher component in header
5. Set up language detection based on browser settings
6. Implement SEO-friendly language-specific URLs
7. Create utility functions for translation handling
8. Ensure all static content is properly internationalized
9. Test language persistence during session using cookies or localStorage
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify language switching works correctly on all pages
2. Test automatic language detection based on browser settings
3. Confirm all content is properly translated in both languages
4. Validate SEO meta tags are correctly translated
5. Test language persistence during navigation
6. Verify URL structure reflects selected language

subtasks.title: Configure Next.js i18n Settings
subtasks.description: Set up the i18n configuration in next.config.js to define supported locales, default locale, and enable internationalized routing.
subtasks.details: Edit next.config.js to include the i18n object with an array of supported locales and a defaultLocale. Ensure routing is enabled for these locales.

subtasks.title: Establish Translation File Structure
subtasks.description: Create a directory structure for translation files, with separate JSON files for each supported language containing key-value pairs for translatable strings.
subtasks.details: Create a 'locales' directory at the project root. Inside, add files like en.json, fr.json, etc., each containing the necessary translations.

subtasks.details: Build a React component that lists available locales and updates the application's locale when a user selects a different language.

subtasks.title: Set Up Language Detection Logic
subtasks.description: Implement logic to detect the user's preferred language (e.g., from browser settings or cookies) and automatically set the locale on initial visit.
subtasks.details: Use middleware or client-side logic to read the user's language preference and redirect or set the locale accordingly.

subtasks.title: Configure SEO-Friendly URL Structure
subtasks.description: Ensure that URLs reflect the selected language (e.g., /en/about, /fr/about) and that proper hreflang tags are set for SEO optimization.
subtasks.details: Update routing and metadata to include locale prefixes in URLs and add hreflang tags to pages for search engine optimization.

5. Validate robots.txt configuration
6. Test breadcrumb navigation functionality
7. Verify heading structure follows proper hierarchy

subtasks.title: Implement Meta Tags Optimization
subtasks.description: Create and optimize meta tags across all website pages including title tags, meta descriptions, and header tags
subtasks.details: Craft compelling meta descriptions that include target keywords. Ensure title tags are under 60 characters and meta descriptions under 160 characters. Include primary keywords in H1 tags and use H2-H6 tags hierarchically throughout content. Customize URLs to include relevant keywords.

subtasks.title: Implement Structured Data Markup
subtasks.description: Add schema.org markup to enhance search result appearance with rich snippets
subtasks.details: Implement JSON-LD structured data for organization information, products, articles, FAQs, reviews, and events as applicable. Test implementation using Google's Structured Data Testing Tool and fix any errors. Ensure structured data aligns with actual page content.

subtasks.title: Generate and Submit Sitemap and Configure Robots.txt
subtasks.description: Create XML sitemap and optimize robots.txt file for proper search engine crawling
subtasks.details: Generate comprehensive XML sitemap including all important pages. Submit sitemap to Google Search Console and Bing Webmaster Tools. Configure robots.txt to block unnecessary crawling of duplicate or low-value pages while ensuring important content remains accessible.

subtasks.title: Implement Hreflang Tags for Multilingual SEO
subtasks.description: Add hreflang attributes to indicate language alternatives for international audiences
subtasks.details: Identify all language/region variants of content. Implement proper hreflang tags in the head section of each page or via sitemap. Ensure reciprocal hreflang references between all language versions. Test implementation using international targeting tools in Google Search Console.

subtasks.title: Optimize for Local SEO
subtasks.description: Implement local SEO optimizations to improve visibility in location-based searches
subtasks.details: Create and verify Google Business Profile. Implement local business schema markup with accurate NAP (Name, Address, Phone) information. Optimize for local keywords in content and meta tags. Ensure consistent business information across all online directories and citation sources.

tasks.title: Implement Analytics Integration
tasks.description: Integrate Google Analytics 4 for user behavior tracking, event tracking for CTA interactions, and conversion goal setup.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify GA4 is correctly tracking page views
2. Test event tracking for all CTA interactions
3. Validate conversion goals are properly recorded
4. Test user journey tracking across pages
5. Verify language preference tracking
6. Test consent management functionality
7. Validate data collection in GA4 dashboard

tasks.title: Implement Performance Optimization
tasks.description: Optimize website performance with image optimization, code splitting, minification, and CDN integration.
tasks.details:
1. Implement Next.js Image component for all images with:
   - Proper sizing and responsive variants
   - WebP format with JPEG/PNG fallbacks
   - Lazy loading for below-the-fold images
   - Placeholder blurring for large images
2. Optimize font loading with:
   - Font display swap
   - Preload for critical fonts
   - Subset fonts to include only necessary characters
3. Implement code splitting and dynamic imports:
   - Use Next.js automatic code splitting
   - Implement dynamic imports for non-critical components
4. Configure caching strategy:
   - Set appropriate cache headers for static assets
   - Implement stale-while-revalidate strategy
5. Minimize CSS and JavaScript:
   - Use PurgeCSS with Tailwind to remove unused styles
   - Minify JavaScript with Terser
6. Implement critical CSS extraction
7. Configure CDN integration through Vercel or similar platform
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Run Lighthouse performance audits on all pages
2. Test Core Web Vitals metrics (LCP, FID, CLS)
3. Verify image optimization using browser dev tools
4. Measure Time to Interactive on mobile devices
5. Test loading performance on slow connections
6. Validate caching strategy effectiveness
7. Verify bundle sizes using build analytics

subtasks.title: Image Optimization
subtasks.description: Analyze and optimize all images by compressing, resizing, and converting to efficient formats (e.g., JPEG, PNG, WebP). Implement lazy loading for non-critical images to reduce initial load times.
subtasks.details: Ensure images are not resized via CSS but are served at the correct dimensions. Use compression tools and consider next-gen formats for further optimization. Implement lazy loading to defer offscreen images.

subtasks.title: Font Loading Optimization
subtasks.description: Optimize font loading by minimizing the number of font files, using efficient formats, and implementing font-display strategies to avoid render-blocking.
subtasks.details: Subset fonts to include only used glyphs, use modern formats like WOFF2, and apply font-display: swap or similar CSS to improve perceived performance.

subtasks.title: Code Splitting and Dynamic Imports
subtasks.description: Implement code splitting and dynamic imports to load only the necessary JavaScript for each page or feature, reducing initial bundle size and improving load times.
subtasks.details: Use build tools or frameworks that support code splitting (e.g., Webpack, React.lazy) to break code into smaller chunks loaded on demand.

subtasks.title: Caching Strategy
subtasks.description: Develop and implement a caching strategy for static and dynamic assets to reduce server load and improve repeat visit performance.
subtasks.details: Leverage browser caching, set appropriate cache-control headers, and consider service workers for advanced caching of dynamic content.

subtasks.title: CSS and JavaScript Minification
subtasks.description: Minify CSS and JavaScript files to remove unnecessary characters, whitespace, and comments, reducing file sizes and improving load times.
subtasks.details: Use automated build tools to minify assets and bundle files where appropriate. Ensure minification does not break functionality.

subtasks.title: CDN Integration
subtasks.description: Integrate a Content Delivery Network (CDN) to distribute static assets across geographically distributed servers, reducing latency and improving asset delivery speed.
subtasks.details: Configure CDN for all static assets (images, CSS, JS, fonts) and ensure cache invalidation strategies are in place for updates.

tasks.title: Implement Accessibility Enhancements
tasks.description: Enhance website accessibility to meet WCAG 2.1 standards with proper alt text, color contrast, keyboard navigation, and screen reader compatibility.
tasks.details:
1. Add descriptive alt text to all images
2. Ensure color contrast meets WCAG 2.1 AA standards:
   - Text: minimum 4.5:1 ratio against background
   - Large text: minimum 3:1 ratio
   - UI components: minimum 3:1 ratio
3. Implement keyboard navigation:
   - Proper tab order
   - Focus indicators
   - Skip to content link
4. Add ARIA attributes where necessary:
   - aria-label
   - aria-describedby
   - aria-expanded
   - aria-hidden
5. Ensure proper heading hierarchy (H1-H6)
6. Implement form accessibility:
   - Associated labels
   - Error messages
   - Required field indicators
7. Test with screen readers (NVDA, VoiceOver)
8. Add language attributes to HTML elements
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Run automated accessibility tests using axe or similar tools
2. Test keyboard navigation on all pages
3. Verify screen reader compatibility
4. Check color contrast using WebAIM Contrast Checker
5. Validate form accessibility
6. Test with users who rely on assistive technologies if possible
7. Verify heading structure is logical

subtasks.title: Implement Image Alt Text and Descriptions
subtasks.description: Add meaningful alt text to all images and provide extended descriptions where necessary to ensure non-text content is accessible to screen readers.
subtasks.details: Review all images across the site, ensuring each has descriptive alt attributes. For complex images (charts, infographics), provide detailed descriptions either inline or via linked content.

subtasks.title: Verify and Enhance Color Contrast
subtasks.description: Check all text and interactive elements for sufficient color contrast according to WCAG AA standards and adjust styles as needed.
subtasks.details: Audit color contrast ratios using automated tools and manual checks. Update CSS to ensure a minimum contrast ratio of 4.5:1 for normal text and 3:1 for large text.

subtasks.title: Implement Keyboard Navigation
subtasks.description: Ensure all interactive elements and navigation can be accessed and operated using only a keyboard.
subtasks.details: Test tab order, focus indicators, and keyboard shortcuts. Fix any elements that are not reachable or operable via keyboard, and ensure logical navigation flow.

subtasks.title: Add ARIA Attributes Where Necessary
subtasks.description: Apply appropriate ARIA (Accessible Rich Internet Applications) attributes to enhance accessibility for dynamic content and complex UI components.
subtasks.details: Identify components that require ARIA roles, states, or properties (e.g., modals, accordions, live regions). Add and test ARIA attributes to improve screen reader support without duplicating native semantics.

subtasks.title: Enhance Form Accessibility
subtasks.description: Improve the accessibility of all forms by ensuring proper labeling, error handling, and keyboard operability.
subtasks.details: Label all form fields, associate errors with inputs, provide clear instructions, and ensure forms are fully usable with assistive technologies and keyboard navigation.

tasks.title: Implement Cross-Browser and Device Testing
tasks.description: Conduct comprehensive testing across different browsers, devices, and screen sizes to ensure consistent functionality and appearance.
tasks.details:
1. Test on major desktop browsers:
   - Chrome (latest 2 versions)
   - Firefox (latest 2 versions)
   - Safari (latest 2 versions)
   - Edge (latest 2 versions)
2. Test on mobile browsers:
   - iOS Safari
   - Chrome for Android
   - Samsung Internet
3. Test on different device sizes:
   - Mobile phones (320px - 428px)
   - Tablets (768px - 1024px)
   - Laptops (1025px - 1440px)
   - Desktops (1441px+)
4. Test touch interactions on mobile and tablet devices
5. Verify responsive behavior and breakpoints
6. Test loading performance on different network conditions
7. Validate form submissions across browsers
8. Test language switching on all devices
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Use BrowserStack or similar service for device testing
2. Create test matrix covering all browser/device combinations
3. Document and fix any inconsistencies
4. Verify critical user journeys on all platforms
5. Test with actual devices when possible
6. Validate performance metrics across browsers
7. Document browser-specific workarounds if necessary

subtasks.title: Desktop Browser Testing Implementation
subtasks.description: Set up and execute comprehensive tests across all supported desktop browsers (e.g., Chrome, Firefox, Edge, Safari) to verify consistent functionality, layout, and performance.
subtasks.details: Identify supported desktop browsers and their versions. Use manual and automated tools to test core features, UI rendering, and compatibility. Document any browser-specific issues and resolutions.

subtasks.title: Mobile Browser Testing Implementation
subtasks.description: Conduct tests on major mobile browsers (e.g., Chrome Mobile, Safari Mobile, Samsung Internet) to ensure the application works as intended on mobile platforms.
subtasks.details: Select target mobile browsers and devices. Use emulators and real devices to test navigation, layout, and performance. Record discrepancies and document fixes.

subtasks.title: Device Size and Responsiveness Testing
subtasks.description: Verify application responsiveness and layout integrity across a range of device sizes and resolutions, including desktops, tablets, and smartphones.
subtasks.details: Test the application on various screen sizes using responsive design tools and real devices. Check for layout breakpoints, content overflow, and usability issues. Document findings and adjustments.

subtasks.title: Touch Interaction Verification and Documentation
subtasks.description: Test and validate all touch-based interactions (e.g., tap, swipe, pinch) on touch-enabled devices, and compile comprehensive documentation of the testing process and results.
subtasks.details: Perform manual testing of touch gestures on mobile and tablet devices. Ensure all interactive elements respond correctly to touch input. Create detailed documentation covering test cases, results, and any issues found.

tasks.title: Implement Deployment Configuration
tasks.description: Configure deployment settings for Vercel or alternative hosting platform with automatic deployments, environment variables, and domain setup.
tasks.details:
1. Set up Vercel project configuration:
   - Connect to Git repository
   - Configure build settings
   - Set up environment variables
2. Configure custom domain:
   - Add domain to Vercel project
   - Configure DNS settings
   - Set up SSL certificate
3. Implement deployment environments:
   - Production
   - Preview (for pull requests)
   - Development
4. Configure build optimizations:
   - Enable compression
   - Configure caching headers
   - Enable serverless functions if needed
5. Set up continuous integration:
   - Automated tests before deployment
   - Lighthouse CI for performance monitoring
6. Configure error monitoring with Sentry or similar
7. Implement logging and analytics
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify successful deployment to all environments
2. Test custom domain configuration and SSL
3. Validate environment variables are correctly applied
4. Test automatic deployments from Git
5. Verify preview deployments for pull requests
6. Test rollback functionality
7. Validate error monitoring and logging

tasks.title: Final Review and Launch Preparation
tasks.description: Conduct comprehensive review of all website features, content, and performance before official launch.
tasks.details:
1. Perform final content review:
   - Check all text for spelling and grammar
   - Verify translations are complete and accurate
   - Ensure all images have proper alt text
   - Validate all links work correctly
2. Conduct final technical review:
   - Run Lighthouse audits on all pages
   - Verify Core Web Vitals compliance
   - Check SEO implementation
   - Validate analytics tracking
3. Perform security checks:
   - Run security scanning tools
   - Verify HTTPS implementation
   - Check Content Security Policy
4. Create launch checklist:
   - Domain configuration
   - SSL certificate
   - Robots.txt and sitemap
   - Google Search Console verification
   - Analytics configuration
5. Prepare documentation:
   - Technical documentation
   - Content update procedures
   - Maintenance guidelines
6. Conduct final stakeholder review
7. Prepare launch announcement materials
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Create comprehensive test plan covering all features
2. Perform user acceptance testing with stakeholders
3. Verify all user stories acceptance criteria are met
4. Conduct final cross-browser and device testing
5. Validate performance meets requirements
6. Test all contact methods and CTAs
7. Perform final accessibility audit
